meanings.definition: Not even or level in surface or texture.
meanings.sent1: The unevener ground made it difficult to walk without stumbling.
meanings.sent2: The unevener terrain required careful navigation.
meanings.sent3: The unevener floor seemed to have a mind of its own, causing people to trip unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Her unevener painting style added depth and character to her artwork.
meanings.sent5: The unevener surface of the road was a bumpy ride for the cyclists.

meanings.definition: Not uniform or consistent in quality or quantity.
meanings.sent1: The unevener distribution of resources led to disparities in the community.
meanings.sent2: The unevener sizes of the cookies made them look homemade.
meanings.sent3: His unevener grades kept his parents guessing about his academic performance.
meanings.sent4: The unevener flow of customers affected the business's revenue.
meanings.sent5: The unevener mix of colors created a unique pattern on the fabric.
